page.title: 06Life in Dunchurch,Rugby
page.content: Grid ref.485713 Twenty-eight children from{Dunchurch {Middle School},aged 11-12,were asked about various aspects of their lives. All received pocket money averaging Â£1.33.Nineteen lived in detached houses and seven in semi-detached,none in bungalows or flats.All but one had a car in the family,some having more than one-Ford,Austin-Rover & Talbot being the most popular. Sports & hobbies included swimming, B.M.X.(Bicycle Motor Cross),football, break-dancing and fishing. Everyone had a colour television,17 had computers,20 had washing-machines and 7 had dish-washers. Most went away for holidays,50% went abroad,France & Spain being popular. Cornwall was the most popular British resort. Most had a daily newspaper.
